data.title: Added a check for IsInMap(cell) to missiles
data.body: and destroy them when they leave the map boundaries to fix #5582.

data.title: Old Lua API scripts throw every tick
data.body:
On intervention:

```
NLua.Exceptions.LuaScriptException: [string "mission.lua"]:225: attempt to perform arithmetic on a string value
```

and allies-02-classic

```
NLua.Exceptions.LuaScriptException: [string "mods/common/lua/mission.lua"]:32: attempt to perform arithmetic on a string value
```

gets spammed every tick in the debug text area which is very noisy. This is probably best fixed by migrating them from this dieing API. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5490

data.title: Add capturable technology support.
data.body:
This adds support for building units from other factions when you capture their production structures.  This adds plumbing for both shared and per-actor production queues, but only implements the yaml rules for TD.  a82764aa3cb9cea5945ea7385148b80f663271e8 shows how this can be done for the other mods.

The race prerequsites can also be used for faction-specific support powers on shared structures.

data.title: Installation removed all mods in the mods folder, including non-standard ones
data.body:
I just went from playtest 20140602 to release 20140608 and noticed that it had deleted all mods from the mods folder, and not just those included in the installation.

It would be nice if there was a warning that this will occur, or (even better) it only deleted the standard mods from the mods folder.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2758843-installation-removed-all-mods-in-the-mods-folder-including-non-standard-ones?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Documented the AutoTarget stances system
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#autotarget was not clear without reading the source code.

data.title: Units sometimes don't leave the production exit
data.body: They will sit at the door instead of completing the "move into world" activity to the exit cell.

data.title: TD force-start panel size is incorrect
data.body:
![screen shot 2014-06-21 at 17 40 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/3347973/7e74bce6-f908-11e3-8d1e-a4443a1e670a.png)

Probably a regression from #5192.

data.title: Clean up MapPreviewWidget.
data.body: I extracted the lobby fixes from #5196 and made some additional cleanups. Fixes #5665.

data.title: Reduce memory allocation in the main loop
data.body:
A few final tweaks for reducing memory allocations in the main game loop. This is the last of the easy stuff on the memory side of things. I don't think there are any more particularly easy wins to be had just from tweaking individual functions sadly.

On the plus side, things have improved enough that the GC is doing a fairly light amount of work now, so that's nice.

data.title: Fix and optimize FindTilesInCircle
data.body:
- Added the `minRange` parameter and renamed it to `FindTilesInAnnulus`.
- For a couple of cases where an annulus was wanted, I replaced the `outer circle - inner circle` logic with a call to get the annulus.
- Fixed and optimized `NearestMoveableCell` and `NearestCell`. This changes the existing behavior where the min range was being ignored.
- The precalculated tile offsets are now sorted by distance to avoid sorting them later.

data.title: Awareness: OpenRA.Mods.D2k.ThrowsShrapnel -> System.DivideByZeroException
data.body:
Got a divide by zero crash while abusing ThrowsShrapnel to create a clusterbomb.

Took me a while to realize that it was caused by:
`MersenneTwister -> public int Next(int low, int high) { return low + Next() % (high - low); }`
because I had specified:
`Pieces: 32, 32`

And I suspect the only reason I figured it out is because I had recently been looking at the MersenneTwister class out of interest of how synced random numbers are done in OpenRA.

Perhaps a note on the wiki for ThrowsShrapnel to warn of not using the same number?
You have to specify at least 2, otherwise ThrowsShrapnel 
`var pieces = self.World.SharedRandom.Next(info.Pieces[0], info.Pieces[1]);`
is unhappy.

Or perhaps a check on the Next overload to avoid the possibility? (I.e. just return the number.)

```
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18033
Exception of type `System.DivideByZeroException`: Attempted to divide by zero.
   at OpenRA.Mods.D2k.ThrowsShrapnel.Killed(Actor self, AttackInfo attack)
   at OpenRA.Traits.Health.InflictDamage(Actor self, Actor attacker, Int32 damage, WarheadInfo warhead, Boolean ignoreModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Traits.HealthExts.InflictDamage(Actor self, Actor attacker, Int32 damage, WarheadInfo warhead)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.DemoTruck.<Explode>c__AnonStoreyA6.<>m__E2(World w)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: updated drop-zone-battle-of-tikiaki map.yaml
data.body: Replaced 7x "Multi17" (not existing) with "Multi7" and 1x "Multi11" (also not existing) with "Multi1".

data.title: Clean up project settings
data.body:
Somewhat related to #5457: just some general cleanup of the solution config.
- Create single platform config named x86 and have all projects target x86.
- Remove Release config (since it's broken anyway).
- For the Debug config, ensure TRACE and DEBUG constants are set and unsafe code is allowed for all projects (same as the makefile).
- Warn level 4 and optimizations off were removed from the config automatically by VS (it assumes these values by default, and these match the makefile).
- The CrashDialog project can reuse the icon from the Game project as long as the path is set correctly.
- Fix TS project so it builds (I know it's going but it's annoying that the project must be unloaded).

I checked out this branch into a clean directory and rebuilt to ensure I didn't break anything this time. Worked for me and VS presents no warnings.

data.title: Smaller minimaps on map list?
data.body:
It would be nice to have some option to change minimaps size in the map list, so its easier to browse through the list.

Example:
![](http://i5.minus.com/i66ZMBKG2vtXF.png)

This almost doubles the minimaps on one page and you can still see the maps as good as before.

I also removed useless information such as "large / small / huge" etc, and creator and map type; i think those could be shown only when you sort map by those options.

If you want to play large or small map, you probably sort the maps by size first. and so on.

Just so you can see the difference, before:
![](http://i3.minus.com/ibz7LtqE1zHBrP.png)

data.title: Sort map list by map name etc?
data.body:
It's quite hard to find a map when the list gets very big.

Could we have some sorting options such as:
- Map name
- Map size
- Player count
- Creator

That would be nice...

data.title: Fixed #5664
data.body:
Mission description scrolls to the top whenever a new mission is
selected to avoid out-of-bounds scroll bar.

data.title: Implemented bonus for multiple players repairing #3748
data.body: See commit description

data.title: Game lobby, tooltip spawnpoint gone
data.body:
Is it just me or is the tooltip when you hover over a spawnpoint (A,B,C,..)  in the game lobby gone since latest release?

It is now more difficult to match the player with the spawnpoint.

data.title: Description scrollbar out-of-bounds when changing mission selection
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Open the missions screen from the RA single-player.
- Select a mission with a long description (e.g. Intervention).
- Scroll to the bottom of the description.
- Select a mission with a description long enough for a scrollbar, but shorter than the current description (e.g. Allies 01).
- Scrollbar will now extend out of its bounds.

Harmless and the scrollbar recovers just fine if you try and use it. Just looks silly.

data.title: Idea: Multiplex UI for ProductionQueue
data.body:
====What it is====
It would be useful for us older folks if for the ProductionQueue trait (one that causes multiple build queues) had an associated 'global' queue, that when a production order is given through it, automatically assigns the production order to the next least busy queue (i.e. least amounts of ticks left before its production finishes).

--Example--
You want to build 5 harvesters simultaneously. You have 5 idle war factories.
Currently you have to go to each queue, and click on harvester once in each.
With the multiplex UI queue you would see a queue 'G', which if you shift-click on harvester in it, will order each queue to build 1 harvester.

--Example--
You want to build 3 harvesters simultaneously. You have 2 idle war factories.
You click once on harvester in the multiplex UI queue. It assigns a harvester to queue 1.
You click once on harvester in the multiplex UI queue. Queue 1 is already busy, so it checks queue 2. It assigns 1 harvester to queue 2.
You click once on harvester in the multiplex UI queue. Queue 1 is already busy and 1% done. Queue 2 is busy and 0% done. It assigns a harvester to queue 1.

====Showing progress====
The multiplex queue would only show you the progress of the most completed production item, showing other queued items simply as numbers for queued up production as per normal.
Once production completes (and unit exits/player places building) the queue updates with the next most completed production, if any.

--Example--
You have 2 construction yards. You are busy building both a refinery (99% done) and a war factory (70% done).
The refinery finishes and shows ready. The war factory still shows as a 1 in the queue, you cannot see its progress unless you go to the relevant build queue.
You place the refinery. The multiplex queue updates and shows the war factory is currently 75% done.

--Example--
You have 5 construction yards. You shift-queued 5 silos. All 5 finish during the same tick.
The multiplex shows you a silo is ready, and 4 more are queued.
You place one. It immediately shows you another is ready, with 3 more queued.
Etc.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2711429-idea-multiplex-ui-for-productionqueue?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Documented some order related traits
data.body: There are still some more that could need a descriptive line. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits

data.title: Confused Capture System.
data.body:
You play as GDI. Your enemy is playing as Nod and has every single structure made in the tech tree. You capture the Nod MCV. Suddenly you can already build everything straight from the tree. Right down to the temple of nod without building its requirements.

However, If you kill the enemies communication center, suddenly you cant build the temple of nod anymore. If you build the Communication center from the captured MCV, it wont let you build the temple of nod still.

This applies to airstrip capture aswell. You capture it but you cant build a thing from it because it says "Requires Refinery" for the harvestor. I have a refinery obviously but still cant build it. Even building the captured MCV Nod faction type it wont let you build it.

Its because the properties on the MCV capture via its player/faction is tied directly to what that player/faction has. 

This also seems to glitch when I capture an MCV of Nod and just pack and run away. If my opponent manages to get yet another MCV and techs up, I can suddenly build structures from it which in turn, basicaly allows me to tech up for free.
